question: Alex has a vegetable stand at the town square. He sells three kinds of vegetables: lilies, roses and daisies. He usually sells lilies for €3.53 per bouquet, roses for €3.5238461538461543 per bouquet and daisies for €6.194 per bouquet. Alex has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Alex sells 5 bouquets of lilies, 20 bouquets of roses and 40 bouquets of daisies, how much will he make?
answer:
Alex will round his lilies up from €3.53 to €4, since the number following the 3 is 5 or higher.
Alex will round his roses up from €3.5238461538461543 to €4, since the number following the 3 is 5 or higher.
Alex will round his daisies down from €6.194 to €6, since the number following the 6 is less than 5.
Alex sells 5 lilies*€4 = €<<5*4=20>>20
Alex sells 20 roses*€4 = €<<20*4=80>>80
Alex sells 40 daisies*€6 = €<<40*6=240>>240
Altogether, Alex will make €20 + €80 + €240 = €<<20+80+240=340>>340
#### 340
